SEARCH
Package io.github.josephmeghanathd

Class NanoRetry<T>

java.lang.Object
io.github.josephmeghanathd.NanoRetry<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the result returned by the retryable operation.
public final class NanoRetry<T> extends Object
NanoRetry is a lightweight, high-performance retry library designed specifically for the Virtual Thread era (JDK 21+).

Unlike traditional libraries that rely on complex state machines or reactive patterns, NanoRetry embraces synchronous blocking logic. When running on a Virtual Thread, operations like Thread.sleep() and Future.get(long, TimeUnit) unmount the virtual thread from the carrier thread, making it extremely resource-efficient.

Example usage:


 String result = NanoRetry.of(() -> client.call())
     .withMaxAttempts(3)
     .withBackoff(Backoff.exponential(Duration.ofMillis(100), 2.0))
     .retryOn(IOException.class)
     .withTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(5))
     .execute();
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Joseph Meghanath

      public static <T> NanoRetry<T> of(CheckedSupplier<T> action)
      Initializes a retry configuration for an operation that returns a value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The return type.
      Parameters:
      action - A CheckedSupplier containing the logic to be retried.
      Returns:
      A new NanoRetry instance for fluent configuration.

    • of

      public static NanoRetry<Void> of(CheckedRunnable action)
      Initializes a retry configuration for a side-effect operation (no return value).
      Parameters:
      action - A CheckedRunnable containing the logic to be retried.
      Returns:
      A new NanoRetry instance for fluent configuration.

    • withMaxAttempts

      public NanoRetry<T> withMaxAttempts(int maxAttempts)
      Sets the maximum number of attempts (including the initial call).
      Parameters:
      maxAttempts - Total number of attempts. Default is 1.
      Returns:
      This instance for fluent chaining.

    • withBackoff

      public NanoRetry<T> withBackoff(Backoff backoff)
      Configures the backoff strategy to determine the delay between retries.
      Parameters:
      backoff - A Backoff implementation (e.g., fixed, linear, exponential).
      Returns:
      This instance for fluent chaining.

    • retryOn

      public NanoRetry<T> retryOn(Class<? extends Throwable> exceptionClass)
      Specifies an exception type that should trigger a retry. If this method is never called, the engine retries on all exceptions by default.
      Parameters:
      exceptionClass - The exception class to filter for.
      Returns:
      This instance for fluent chaining.

    • withTimeout

      public NanoRetry<T> withTimeout(Duration timeout)
      Sets a global timeout for the entire execution sequence (including all retries and backoffs).
      Parameters:
      timeout - The total allowed duration.
      Returns:
      This instance for fluent chaining.

    • withPerAttemptTimeout

      public NanoRetry<T> withPerAttemptTimeout(Duration timeout)
      Sets a timeout for each individual attempt. If an attempt exceeds this duration, it is cancelled and treated as a failure.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The duration allowed per attempt.
      Returns:
      This instance for fluent chaining.

    • execute

      public T execute() throws Exception
      Executes the configured retry logic.

      This method uses a Executors.newVirtualThreadPerTaskExecutor() to manage timeouts. The calling thread will block until a result is produced or the retry policy is exhausted.

      Returns:
      The result of the successful operation.
      Throws:
      Exception - The last encountered exception if all attempts fail, or a TimeoutException if the global timeout is exceeded.
